name: discriminable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If two things are discriminable, it is possible to see, hear, or measure the difference between them: The faces used in the test were highly discriminable.discriminable from These problems have been shown to be discriminable from normal age-related changes.
More examplesFewer examplesVowel length contrasts are more discriminable in Arabic than in Japanese. The study found that most contrasts were discriminable to both groups of infants.On the first trial, an easily discriminable test contrast was present.The cells were of two basic types, discriminable by shape.
